questions.question: 2. Sieve analysis is used when size of particle is ____
3. For coarse grained soil, the particle size D<sub>10</sub> is sometimes called as __________

explanations.a: The size D<sub>10</sub> is sometimes called as the effective size or effective diameter.

questions.question: 4. A soil having a uniformity coefficient smaller than about 2 is considered ‘uniform’.

explanations.a: Coefficient of uniformity, D<sub>60</sub> Particle size in mm such that 60% of the soil is finer than this size. D<sub>10</sub> Particle size in mm such that 10% of the soil is finer than this size. For uniformly graded soil, is nearly 1 For a well graded gravel, For a well graded sand, Therefore, the soil having a uniformity coefficient smaller than about 2 is considered uniform. For a well graded gravel, cu >4 For a well graded sand, Cu >6
